intro: Prionium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. Prionium species are typically found in coastal areas and rocky soils, thriving in saline environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
